args:
As the party pursues Bahamut, Audric uses
a forbidden art passed down through the rulers
of Alberia in order to quell the dragon's rage.
The party then uses a magical faerie art to enter
Zethia's mind in order to save her.
It won't be that easy, Bahamut!
Sacred Tree: Bough to the Canopy
We're nearly at the top. Is everyone ready?
It would serve us well to be resolved\nfor what may lie ahead.
Namely, what are we to do with Zethia?
We're gonna save her, right? ...RIGHT?!\nWE'RE GONNA SAVE HER, RIGHT, GUYS?!
That is, of course, the intention. However,\nwe would be fools to charge into this\nsituation without an adequate plan.
Nedrick? Jinlorda? Can you use your\nmagic to let us enter her mind?
If we can go inside her mind like we did\nwith Nedrick, that might work.
It should be possible. And it's likely our\nonly chance to save her. However...
The pseudo-Bahamut Zethia summoned\nis the problem. If we enter her mind,\nour flesh remains here.

It would be quicker and cleaner to pitch
ourselves off the top of the tree rather
than leave our bodies unattended with
Bahamut raging about.
We need to sort things out with the\nBahamut here before we attempt to\nenter anyone's mind.

So to do something about Bahamut,
we have to go into Zethia's mind,
but to go into Zethia's mind, we have
to do something about Bahamut?
If this is a joke, I ain't laughing!
Jape or no, it is the reality we face.
What if we were to split into two groups?\nOne deals with Bahamut in the real world,\nwhile the other goes into Zethia's mind.
It's a good plan, but right now, the only\none who can actually manage to hold\nBahamut back would be Nedrick.
And without Nedrick, it's unlikely we can\ndeal with the Bahamut in Zethia's mind.

Okay, enough with the circular logic.
The Alberian royal family's been making
pacts with dragons for hundreds of years
now, yeah?
In that case, you must have some kind of\nspecial tricks for when you lose control of\na pactbound dragon or something.
I don't think it's quite that simple.

A person does not form a pact with a
dragon they cannot control to begin with.
Those who are not qualified to do so
simply do not become pactbearers.

There is a forbidden art passed down in
the Alberian royal family which can share
the load for those who cannot manage the
burden of a pact.
Yes. The skill allows one to create a\nsubstitute that shares the pact's burden.
If one cannot make a pact with a dragon,\nthey have no right to rule Alberia.

However, among leaders of old, there
were some who used this forbidden
technique to form pacts and become
monarchs despite lacking the talent.
To do such a thing would be tantamount\nto betraying the kingdom and its people!
But there's reason to believe it was done.\nI can think of rulers from the past who had\nno business calling themselves pactbound.
The royal family's history stretches back\nthree centuries, and some of its moments\nare not, shall we say, outstanding.
There is a dark side to that history that\nnever sees the light of public scrutiny.
And you think we could use this technique\nto save Zethia?
I cannot state it conclusively, but the\npossibility exists that it could free Zethia\nfrom Bahamut's grip and awaken her.
And then we could subdue the raging\nBahamut. After that...
We would just need to get the better of\nBahamut's will inside Zethia's mind.
I love it when a plan comes together.\nLet's do this thing!
...Of course. But there's a certain matter\nI'm not satisfied with.
If you know some of the deepest,\ndarkest secrets of the royal family,\nthen you must be...
I presume you'll be giving us a full\naccounting of who exactly you are, Audric?
All will be explained in time—I swear it.\nBut for now...
For now we have to save Zethia!
Audric! You take care of Zethia!
(I shall save you this time, Zethia.\nI swear it!)
Your duty is mine. Your burden is mine.\nLet thy pact be mine own weight to share!
Zethia! Come back to us, girl!
Ah! Now I remember! Bahamut, he...
Worry not, Zethia. Bahamut will no longer\nbe able to use you as he wills.
And you, Audric? Are you all right?\nYou just took on Zethia's burden,\ndid you not?

It is not a problem for the present,
but I do not imagine we can relax.
A pact with Bahamut applies potent
pressure indeed...
Then I suspect we all ought to hurry.\nOur crucial turn begins now.
Right. We're going to go into Zethia's mind\nand subdue Bahamut's will. Are you ready\nfor this, Zethia?
As I suspect this is our only option,\nI suppose I am as ready as I will ever be.
(Bahamut controlled me? Truly?\nSomething about this feels off...)
Now is the time to act, Zethia. You will\nunderstand certain things better when\nfaced with Bahamut's will.
Right then. Let us be off so we might\nascertain Bahamut's true intent.
Prepare yourselves to enter the world\nof Zethia's mind!
